question: __________ is a set of software frameworks that provide additional services to application developers.
The operating system kernel consists of all system and application programs in a computer.
All computer systems have some sort of user interaction.
The most common secondary storage device is ____.
Flash memory is slower than DRAM but needs no power to retain its contents.
Interrupts may be triggered by either hardware of software
Which of the following would lead you to believe that a given system is an SMP-type system?
options: Each processor is assigned a specific task.
There is a boss-worker relationship between the processors.
Each processor performs all tasks within the operating system.

question: A clustered system ____.
options: gathers together multiple CPUs to accomplish computational work
is an operating system that provides file sharing across a network
is used when rigid time requirements are present
can only operate one application at a time

question: A dual-core system requires each core has its own cache memory.
A ____ can be used to prevent a user program from never returning control to the operating system.
What is another term for kernel mode?
What statement concerning privileged instructions is considered false?
options: They may cause harm to the system.
They can only be executed in kernel mode.
They cannot be attempted from user mode.
They are used to manage interrupts.

question: Two important design issues for cache memory are ____.
A(n) ________ is the unit of work in a system.
Program counter specifies the current instruction to execute.
UNIX does not allow users to escalate privileges to gain extra permissions for a restricted activity.
Security is equivalent to protection with no difference.
Effective UID is the same as user identifiers (user IDs).
Virtualization software is one member of a class that differs from emulation.
A virtual machine can be switched like a process in the operating system.
VMware application was a virtual machine manager (VMM).
Bluetooth and 802.11 devices use wireless technology to communicate over several feet, in essence creating a ____.
There are a fixed number of network protocols.
Internet is a network of networks.
A stack is a sequentially ordered data structure that uses the first in, first out (FIFO) principle for adding and removing items.
In a binary tree, a parent may have at most two children.
Hash collision refers to the phenomenon of hash function in which two unique inputs result in the same output value.
Embedded computers typically run on a ____ operating system.
Which of the following is a property of peer-to-peer systems?
options: Clients and servers are not distinguished from one another.
Separate machines act as either the client of the server but not both.
They do not offer any advantages over traditional client-server systems.
They suffer from the server acting as the bottleneck in performance.

question: A _____ provides a file-system interface which allows clients to create and modify files.
Which of the following statements concerning open source operating systems is true?
options: They are always more secure than commercial, closed systems.
All open source operating systems share the same set of goals.

question: Which of the following operating systems is not open source?
A ____ is a custom build of the Linux operating system
